pkgmetadata.longdescription: Dynamic Programming Algorithm for Peak Detection in ChIP-Seq Data // A quadratic time dynamic programming algorithm can be used to compute an approximate solution to the problem of finding the most likely changepoints with respect to the Poisson likelihood, subject to a constraint on the number of segments, and the changes which must alternate: up, down, up, down, etc. For more info read http://proceedings.mlr.press/v37/hocking15.html "PeakSeg: constrained optimal segmentation and supervised penalty learning for peak detection in count data" by TD Hocking et al, proceedings of ICML2015.
